node.title: DC Comics Illustrators Seek Police Protection After Bisexual Superman Sparks Angry Threats
node.description: The new Superman was revealed as bisexual last month after he was shown kissing his friend and reporter Jay Nakamura in DC's recent installment.

node.title: Carole Baskin Suit to Block Netflix's 'Tiger King 2' Release Dismissed Hours After Filing
node.description: The order stops Baskin's request to immediately block the second season's release, but leave her open to seek further legal action.

node.title: New Autopsy Rejects Troopers' Claim That Black Man Died in Crash, Shows Other Factors
node.description: A new forensic review of Ronald Greene's case ordered by the FBI has shown that the Louisiana State Police withheld critical information from the coroner.

node.title: Your Wednesday Briefing
node.description: Biden knocks China and Russia.

node.title: In a Connecticut mayor’s race, Bobby Valentine brings in the closer: himself.
node.description: Democrats have ratcheted up their criticism of Mr. Valentine in the final weeks of the campaign, but his outsize presence is a formidable campaign asset.

node.title: Biden Tries to Reassert American Leadership, and His Own
node.description: President Biden hoped his personal style of politicking could help him build global consensus on fighting climate change. But as he has learned in Washington, charm offensives have their limits.

node.title: Here’s who is who in the Kyle Rittenhouse trial.
node.description: A rundown of the key figures in the courtroom for the trial of Kyle Rittenhouse in Kenosha, Wis.

node.title: I Was Told I Have Career Advantages ‘as a Black Woman.’ Here’s How I Replied.
node.description: At this point in my career, as a senior leader, I welcome it when people engage me on the topic of race in the workplace.

node.title: Comments Split on Redditor's Choice to Hand Out Son's Halloween Candy to Teach Lesson
node.description: While most commenters supported the parent for bringing their son home, some felt the punishment went too far.

node.title: Judge Orders Release of Witness in DEA Leaks Case, Gives Him Probation
node.description: "I'd like to say to this honorable judge and court how much I apologize for this mistake," Juan Carlos Dávila-Bonilla said.

node.title: Dame Olivia Newton-John is about to be awarded Japan's highest honour
node.description: Dame Olivia Newton-John was the first foreign artist to perform in Fukushima after its 2011 nuclear disaster. Today, Japan has announced it will award her with its highest civil honour, for services to Japanese music culture.

node.title: Ethiopia declares nationwide state of emergency and urges citizens to defend capital
node.description: The Tigray People's Liberation Front claims to have captured several towns in recent days and says it is considering marching on the capital, Addis Ababa.

node.title: Yahoo leaves China for good, citing 'challenging' environment
node.description: Yahoo's departure comes as Beijing imposes fresh laws and curbs on its internet companies on areas from content to customer privacy.

node.title: 'We'll see if we can do it as well as Matt Damon did': How astronauts will grow plants on the moon
node.description: Within the next five years, astronauts will be growing vegetables in space with technology developed by Australian scientists.

node.title: Māori Covid-19 funding approved for eight groups to boost vaccinations
node.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern is in Northland with Māori Crown Relations Minister Kelvin Davis as the government announces the first round of funding the rollout of Māori vaccine initiatives.

node.title: Democrats reach deal to lower drug prices in $1.75 trillion bill
node.description: The agreement overcomes a key sticking point in ongoing negotiations over the president's domestic policy agenda.

node.title: Cleo Smith found alive by WA police
node.description: WA police say missing four-year-old girl Cleo Smith has been found safe and well in a locked house in Carnarvon.

node.title: NZ horse Verry Elleegant wins Melbourne Cup
node.description: New Zealand horse Verry Elleegant has romped to a stunning win at the Melbourne Cup.

node.title: Are You Missing Out on the Metaverse?
node.description: Pitches for the future of the internet are banking on an old trick: FOMO.

node.title: Raiders Receiver to Be Charged in Fatal Car Crash
node.description: Henry Ruggs III, the Raiders’ top receiver, is expected to be charged with driving under the influence after his involvement in a car crash that killed one person in Las Vegas Tuesday morning.

node.title: China Defends Its Fossil Fuel Emissions, Says U.S. Slowed Down Climate Efforts Under Trump
node.description: At the U.N. climate conference, Chinese climate negotiator Xie Zhenhua spoke about why the nation is so reliant on fossil fuels.

node.title: Drought-Stricken Madagascar a 'Wake-Up Call' to Rest of World Facing Climate Change: U.N.
node.description: "The world needs to look to Madagascar to see what is coming your way and many other countries around the world," WFP Executive Director David Beasley said.

node.title: Price Caps on Insulin, Annual Spending Included in Build Back Better Deal, Schumer Says
node.description: The bill will cap out-of-pocket spending at $2,000 per year and lower the price of insulin from $600 to $35, the Senate Majority Leader said.

node.title: Ruben Gallego: January 6 Riot Was 'Last Gasp' of 'Dying Attitude' of Hate and Division
node.description: In his new memoir "They Called Us 'Lucky': The Life and Afterlife of the Iraq War's Hardest Hit Unit" Ruben Gallego details how a poor Latino student enrolled at Harvard ended up as an infantryman assigned to Lima Company, 3rd Battalion, 25th Marine Regiment, in the sands of Iraq.

node.title: Dow stock index closes above 36,000 for first time
node.description: The 1999 book "Dow 36,000" long exemplified the risks of predicting markets. Now stocks have finally reached the milestone.

node.title: NRA Accused of Illegally Funneling $35 Million To Gun Rights Candidates, Including Trump
node.description: Giffords, a gun control group, said it has been injured by the competitive advantages the NRA has received by "flouting campaign finance laws."

node.title: Australia refuses to join global pledge to cut methane emissions
node.description: Australia snubs one of the key global actions to come out of the UN climate change conference by bowing out of an international pledge to reduce methane emissions.

node.title: Here we go again: Another wet, stormy trough on the way
node.description: A trough extending from the Great Australian Bight all the way to the tropics is set to bring another soggy few days and the chance of storms as it sweeps across the country.

node.title: 'Our most vulnerable group of people': COVID-19 vaccination mandate needed for aged care visitors, peak body says
node.description: The peak body for aged care centres wants a mandate brought in for visitors to be vaccinated against COVID-19 but experts are divided.

node.title: Covid-19: Far North wakes to fresh lockdown restrictions
node.description: The Ngāpuhi Covid-19 response group hopes they can help raise vaccination rates in the region during the lockdown.

node.title: Ohio to pay $17.5M to man paralyzed after he was tackled by guards
node.description: The state has agreed to settle a lawsuit after a 2020 beating by prison guards left Seth Fletcher paralyzed.

node.title: Andrew Yang casts his first-ever vote for N.Y.C. mayor.
node.description: Mr. Yang, a front-runner to become the next mayor of New York himself, did not respond to a question about who he had voted for.

node.title: At the Radio City Christmas Show, Some Workers Worry About Covid Rules
node.description: Employees must all be vaccinated, but some are upset that the upcoming show is not also testing them for the virus, as is done on Broadway and at other major performing venues.

node.title: We Are Losing a Battle We Can Win to Save the World’s Forests
node.description: World leaders have pledged again to end deforestation. This time, they  need to actually do it.

node.title: Lone Surviving Extremist on Trial for Deadly Paris Attacks Recalls Close Ties to Family
node.description: Salah Abdeslam spoke at the beginning of the trial, saying the deaths of so many innocent people were "nothing personal."

node.title: United Way, Salvation Army Top List of Charities Americans Gave Billions to in 2020
node.description: The United Way and Salvation Army's top rank on the charity list came amid the devastating economic troubles of the COVID-19 pandemic.

node.title: Henry Ruggs III, Raiders Player, Accused of Driving Under Influence After Fatal Crash

node.title: Christian Campus Group Wins Official Recognition by University, Continues Funding Fight
node.description: "The application was never denied and was still in process when the lawsuit was filed," said a university official of Ratio Christi's status.

node.title: 'He needs help, not kicked when he's down': Mum's fight for son's mental health

node.title: Who's hot, who's not at WBBL halfway mark?

node.title: 'Not unusual it never gets seen again': Boat missing in Tasmania may not be found, says expert
node.description: The body of missing Tasmanian man Thomas Courto and the boat he was travelling in are still missing. So how does a boat just vanish in Bass Strait without a trace?

node.title: 'You're going to feel seen': New movie puts Western Sydney on the map

node.title: Vaccines for children are coming. These are the frontrunners

node.title: 'Made in China' might be cheap, but it comes with a human cost

node.title: 'Leave it a better place': How tourism can help combat climate change

node.title: Foreign Minister to visit South-East Asia to ease fears over nuclear submarine plan

node.title: The Australian bushfire survivor taking on Scott Morrison at the Glasgow climate summit
node.description: Jo Dodds knows what it is like to be on the climate change frontline, so she went to COP26 to pressure governments into doing more about the crisis.

node.title: 'Clean up our own backyard': Australian miners ramp up plans to cut carbon emissions

node.title: Australia looks like a climate laggard, as other countries ramp-up efforts
node.description: The government is confident Australia will cut emissions by more than 26 per cent below 2005 levels by 2030, but data shows our ambition is insufficient by almost any measure.

node.title: Frydenberg warned less than three months into JobKeeper that millions were going to firms with rising turnovers
node.description: The ABC confirms the federal Treasurer was alerted less than three months into JobKeeper that businesses were getting taxpayer support for six months while increasing their turnovers.

node.title: U.S. officials urge travelers arriving by land to have travel and vaccine documents ready.

node.title: When It Comes to China, Don’t Call It a ‘Cold War’

node.title: In the city where George Floyd was killed, voters decide whether to oust the police.

node.title: Democracy Is the 'Only Leverage' West Has Against China, Former NATO Chief Says

node.title: Australian PM rejects 'slurs' from France amid row

node.title: To Go Big, Sloppy Jane Went Underground

node.title: Christian University Withdraws Invitation for Historian Over Planned Parenthood Ties
node.description: An online petition that racked up about 1,030 signatures by Tuesday morning spurred Samford University to cancel Jon Meacham's appearance.

node.title: American Woman Convicted of Killing Mother in Indonesia Headed Back to U.S

node.title: Tesla loses $40B in value after Musk says Hertz deal not "signed yet"

node.title: Donations to Boston’s mayoral candidates are coming from very different places.

node.title: Tupac Shakur Touring Exhibition Opens in January
node.description: The show, spearheaded by Shakur’s estate, will start out in Los Angeles. It’s “a story about race in America using Tupac as a proxy,” one of its producers said.
